title: GitHub Label Manager Configuration
description: Schema for declaratively managing GitHub issue labels via kjanat/github-labelmanager.

delete.title: Labels to Delete
delete.description: Array of label names to remove from the repository. Use with caution: deleted labels will be removed from all issues. Labels listed here should NOT also appear in the 'labels' array.

items.title: Label Name
items.description: GitHub label name. Maximum 50 characters. May contain letters, numbers, spaces, hyphens, underscores, colons, and other printable characters. Cannot be empty or consist only of whitespace.

labels.title: Labels to Create or Update
labels.description: Array of label definitions. Each label will be created if it doesn't exist, or updated if it does. Use 'aliases' to rename existing labels while preserving issue associations.

items.title: Label Definition
items.description: A GitHub issue label with name, color, description, and optional aliases for renaming.

description.title: Label Description
description.description: Short description explaining when to use this label. Displayed in GitHub's label picker and helps contributors understand label purpose.
examples: New feature or meaningful behavior change

aliases.title: Label Aliases (for Renaming)
aliases.description: Array of old label names that should be renamed to this label's name. When syncing, any existing label matching an alias will be renamed, preserving all issue associations. Useful for standardizing label names across repositories.

items.title: Label Name
items.description: GitHub label name. Maximum 50 characters. May contain letters, numbers, spaces, hyphens, underscores, colons, and other printable characters. Cannot be empty or consist only of whitespace.

color.title: Label Color
color.description: Hex color code for the label background. Can be 3 or 6 characters, with or without leading '#'. GitHub will normalize to 6-char format without '#'.

name.title: Label Name
name.description: The display name of the label. Must be unique within the repository. Supports spaces and special characters. Common patterns include: type labels (bug, feature), priority labels (P0: critical), and area labels (area: ui).

labels.description: New feature or meaningful behavior change
labels.name: feature

labels.description: Broken core flows, must fix ASAP
labels.name: P0: critical
